intro: Centropogon crassifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its thick, broad leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
